MessageStrip.text: We do have one issue with environments if we want to have different users for different systems as we can't get auth credentials from the environment, let's create a workaround

FormattedText.htmlText: 1. Click the 👁 icon and select edit

Text.text: 2. Create two new variables called username and password and set them to 250004 and Myhr1234 respectively
3. Add one more variable called auth and don't set a value , then click update.
4. Click the Pre-request script and replace line 3 with the following
5. Click the Authorization tab and set the type to No Auth
6. Go to the Headers tab and add a header named 'Authorization' and set the value to {{auth}}

MessageStrip.text: Now we use the username and password from the environment as an authentication instead of from the collection. This header would need to be maintained on all subsequent requests as well in the collection

Text.text: 7. Add the same variables to the environment for HEG
8. Select the HEG environment and execute your request

MessageStrip.text: Success, you are well on your way to become a true postman hacker!
